title: Tony Gourley
text:
Anthony "Tony" M. Gourley (birth registered third ¼ 1950) is an English former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1970s and 1980s. He played at representative level for <a href="Lancashire%20rugby%20league%20team">Lancashire</a>, and at club level for <a href="Rochdale%20Hornets">Rochdale Hornets</a>, <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford</a> and , as a .
Background.
Tony Gourley's birth was registered in <a href="Rochdale">Rochdale</a> district, <a href="Lancashire">Lancashire</a>, England.
Career.
Gourley started his career with <a href="Rochdale%20Hornets">Rochdale Hornets</a>. In 1979, he was signed by <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford</a> for a fee of £10,000. A year later he joined the newly formed <a href="London%20Broncos">Fulham</a>, and was a key member of their inaugural squad. He spent five seasons at the club before being forced to retire after suffering an eye injury in a match against <a href="Bridgend%20Blue%20Dragons">Bridgend Blue Dragons</a> in March 1985.
Gourley also played two games for <a href="Lancashire%20rugby%20league%20team">Lancashire</a>.
